data.title: Keybinding for "Toggle Integrated Terminal" keeps resetting to Ctrl+^
data.body: I am on macOS with a german keyboard layout and I want to open the integrated terminal with `Ctrl+<the key above Alt key>`. For that I am assigning that key and the output I see is `Ctrl+[Backquote]`. When I set this it seems to work until I reload the window where it then stops to work.

data.title: Useful error message should be given when uninstall extension
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.12.1
- OS Version: Microsoft Windows [Version 10.0.15063]

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Install extension attached with command line `code --install-extension vscode-arduino-0.2.1.vsix`
[vscode-arduino-0.2.1.zip](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/files/994978/vscode-arduino-0.2.1.zip)
2. Open vscode to make sure the extension is enabled
3. Remain vscode open, and uninstall the extension with command line `code --uninstall-extension vsciot-vscode.vscode-arduino`
4. See the error message

The error message is `[ [ [ , , , , , , , , , , , , , , [Object] ], [ , , [Object] ] ] ]`

![snipaste20170512_112134](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1621293/25981197/47f9f08e-3706-11e7-92e6-faf6fab7eefc.png)

data.title: Don't enter a newline when pressing return on an auto-completion keyword which has been completed
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: `1.12`
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Type in a complete `keyword` which brings up an auto-completion prompt
2. Press `Enter`

In my experience, IDE's tend to just close out the auto-completion box in this scenario. It seems quite unusual to have it input a newline in this situation.

Gif of the issue:

![gif](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/748557/25980883/96f0b674-36c9-11e7-9e84-77d3a47a6b77.gif)

data.title: Incorrect encoding when using DEBUG(node.js inside vscode), it will affect extensions result.
data.body: - VSCode Version: 1.12.1 - OS Version: macOS 10.12.4 Steps to Reproduce: 1.Use system node.js will get the correct result. 2.Set up a DEBUG(launch.json) and run the same code, will return the incorrect encoding result. This problem only happens on macOS platform, it works correct on Windows 10. I found this issue few months ago, still can not fix. [https://github.com/goessner/mdmath/issues/13](url)

data.title: Find Widget UI enhancement
data.body:
Ref Find Widget issues

  * [x] Make it resizeable: [#2657](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/2657), [#2220](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/2220)
  * [x] Bug, Replace Box in Current File Truncated [#5861](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/5861)
  * [x] Cover search result: [#5525](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/5525)

We have a bunch of issues talking about the size or position of Find Widget as it sometimes gets in the way. The root cause is that our single line input box can't handle long text sometimes however the find widget itself sometimes covers the result or text (of course as it's absolute positioned Overlay). There are three ways to mitigate this issue

* Make it resizable. It consists of two dimensions. The first one is resizing the Find Widget horizontally so the find and replace input boxes can be large enough. The second one is resizing it vertically to make it a multiline textarea, this way we can support multiline find and replace. 
* Dock the Find Widget the same way as the query box in Settings page. 
* Change the position of Find Widget if it's covering the search result. Either take Chromium's solution (only reposition horizontally) or Daniel's proposal (the widget can move both vertically and horizontally).

## Resize
The major problem is users find the input box is not wide enough to see all typed in query keywords. We can have two way to mitigate this issue.

### 1. Horizontal resize
Allow users to resize the find widget horizontally (the same way as Visual Studio). The drawback is editor width is your limit.

![resize-horizontal](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/876920/25976254/876f7692-3668-11e7-9f05-5f73e2a0ea90.gif)

### 2. Use textarea when the content is long

Instead of a single line input box, we use textarea to support long text and multi line content (this requires other work though https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/15727)
![textarea-find-widget](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/876920/26071852/67823a56-395e-11e7-801c-c8d55c14399f.gif)

## Re-Position
Right now the Find Widget is an absolute positioned overlay so it sometimes covers the search result. We have several different solutions to solve or mitigate this problem as below

### 1. Move Find Widget horizontally when it's covering the search result
![moving-find-widget](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/876920/26077284/6a42b416-3970-11e7-96b7-38e389aaa558.gif)

This is the way how Chrome handles this issue but it's not a perfect solution as when the editor width is small or not large enough, it still covers the result.

### 2. Move Find Widget both horizontally and vertically
This is suggested by @Tyriar, moving the find widget downwards when the window is not wide enough, especially when we split the window

![moving-find-widget-2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/876920/26089627/2911e6e4-39b4-11e7-8666-2904cffd2bba.gif)

data.title: Can you make it potarble？
data.body: Everything is in the only  one folder.just like this:    https://github.com/garethflowers/vscode-portable

data.title: TypeScript non-null assertion operator breaks subsequent syntax highlighting
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.12.1
- OS Version: Windows 10

Without non-null assertion operator:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/298883/25976150/4c4fd41a-36f6-11e7-89f0-08803a34ac7f.png)

With non-null assertion operator:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/298883/25976139/3bd5d3f0-36f6-11e7-86eb-015c92980bd2.png)

The only difference between the above two examples is the presence of a non-null assertion postfix operator after the expression `vars.get(name)`.

I've tried switching through all my color themes, and they all have the same issue, suggesting this is an issue with the way TypeScript is being tokenized, rather than with any particular theme itself.

data.title: Character  "<" (Less-Than sign)  color becoming red incorrectly on HTML document comment sections
data.body:
When i place a script tag in an html document, and then write two forward slashes to comment out the following line, if i'll then type the "<" (Less-Than sign) character on that line, as:
`<script>   //<`
`</script>`
it becomes red in the VS Code Editor, instead of being green as usual with comments on javascript code.
first I thought that the reason is because "<" character is illegally used in a script tag since this may indicate the starting of a closing-tag, but when I try it in other IDEs they don't give me any error, and I believe that they are right.
Now I realized that the same problem occurs even with the script closing-tag itself, if it is placed right after the two fwd slashes, as:
`<script>   `
`//</script>`
in the latter scenario the "<" character of the closing-tag becomes red.

See image:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/16751213/25975330/abc67eb0-367b-11e7-847e-c87019995d02.png)


 

- VSCode Version: Code 1.12.1 (commit:  f6868fce3eeb16663840eb82123369dec6077a9b)
- OS Version: Windows 10 (x64)

Update:
another issue i found is with "&" character (Ampersand sign), becoming red incorrectly, see image:
![image2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/16751213/25975573/1c080ab2-367d-11e7-8d62-4f0712c01793.PNG)

data.title: Cannot select multiple files in explorer pane
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.12.x
- OS Version: Linux

It would be nice if we could select multiple files at a time in the explorer pane.  This comes in handy when you want to delete several files or if you want to copy/move several files.

data.title: Wrong Japanese localization for "reloadAction"
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version:
バージョン1.13.0-insider
コミット5057c95e6b5a43ddecee0d6f663764b7c80f6c95
日付2017-05-11T06:11:50.856Z
シェル1.6.6
レンダラー56.0.2924.87
Node 7.4.0

"reloadAction" is currently localized as "再読み込む" but it's not natural Japanese.
It should be "再読み込み", or if longer version is preferred, "再度読み込む".

data.title: Multiline Snippets are non-functional
data.body:
- VSCode Version:  **1.12.1**
- OS Version:  **Windows 10 v1607 build 14393.1066**

Until just recently (last update?), multiline snippets were useable, but now that appears to not be the case.  Here is an example of a broken snippet that previously worked:

```
     "Author Comment": {
		"prefix": "Author",
		"body": [
			"<#",
			"	Author:		${Author:Matthew A. Pearon}",
			"	Date:		${Date:yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm}",
			"	Keywords:	${Keywords:Keywords}",
			"	Parameters:	${Parameters:Parameters}",
			"#>"
		],
		"description": "Insert Author Comment Block"
	}
```

When used, it now just return this:
```
<#

,

```

I will be able to attach a gif to this post later.

data.title: Shortcuts and Settings Keyboard search field does not retain what I typed when changing tab or editor group
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.13.0 - Insiders
- OS Version: Windows 10

-- Sorry for the English, I used Google Translator --

Keyboard Shortcuts - First Situation:


1- Open Keyboard Shortcuts and another tab
2- Type Something.
3- Change tab
4- I returned to Keyboard Shortcuts
5- What I typed disappeared.


Keyboard Shortcuts - Second Situation:

1- Open Keyboard Shortcuts and another tab
2- Type Something.
3- Drag the tab to open a new group
4- What I typed disappeared.
5- I returned the guide to the first group
6 - I did not return what I typed.

Settings:

1- Open Settings and another tab
2- Type Something.
3- Drag the tab to open a new group
4- What I typed disappeared.
5- I returned the guide to the first group.
6- What I typed reappears.

data.title: Regex Search/Replace: Transform group to lowercase

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
In a Search-and-Replace operation that uses Regular Expressions it should be possible to apply simple transformations on capture groups, like lowercase or uppercase a capture group.

This would be extremely useful when you for example would like to turn all fields in a C# class into auto-properties and hence would like to PascalCase all identifiers.

In Sublime and TextMate this can be accoplished by using `\L$1` to lowercase capture group 1.

- VSCode Version: 1.12.1
- OS Version: Microsoft Windows [Version 10.0.14393]

data.title: Regression in React type inference in JavaScript
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.12.1
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

In a regular JavaScript file, create a React component with TypeScript annotations

```
export default class ExtendedProfile extends Component<{searchVm: SearchVm, y: string}, any> {
    render() {
    }
}
```

Babel will accept this as valid Flow, and prior versions of Code would treat this as valid TypeScript, and provide nice type inferences in the suggestions.  There seems to have been a recent regression though, where this no longer works. 

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11261266/25969619/31c20a0a-365b-11e7-8a70-3738ab11b7b6.png)

data.title: Bad syntax highlighting on multi-line typescript generics
data.body: - VSCode Version: 1.12 - OS Version: OSX 10.12.4 Steps to Reproduce: 1. Write a multiline generic in a .ts file 2. The colors should be the same as if it was on a single line but it's not: Single line is alright On multiline `OwnProps & ReduxStateProps` becomes blue Here is a simpler example: ``` class Test{} class Favorite extends Test< string | number, undefined > { // class content } ```

data.title: Command Prompt `getmac` run every time I launch VSCode on Windows 10
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.12.1 (f6868fce3eeb16663840eb82123369dec6077a9b, 2017-05-04T21:26:50.689Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.14393
- Extensions: the listing exceeds the lower minimum of browsers' URL characters limit
---

Currently every time when I open VS Code, the `getmac` command is run on command prompt (regardless of whether or not that application is open). I'd like to either remove this functionality or just stop the window from coming up, since I have to manually dismiss it every time I open the application.

Not entirely how/why it started happening, as I noticed it a while ago but never got around to reporting it. Is this a normal occurance? This doesn't happen to me on the Mac version of the app.

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Launch VS Code
2. Command prompt opens (in my case, ConEmu, since I have that overriding the default command prompt) and runs `getmac`.
